array.title: What is dual currency interest accounts?
array.description:
Dual Currency Interest Account is a non-principal protected product with floating return. The yield of the product is secured at the time of purchase, while the currency in which the product will be settled changes depending on how the Settlement Price compares with the Linked Price.

A short-term investment product, Dual Currency could potentially provide very high returns.

array.title: Which terms should I know?
array.description:
Currency

Investment Currency is the currency in which the investment is made into the product. In Dual Currency - BTC, it would always be BTC.


Settlement Currency

Settlement Currency is the currency that you will receive when the product expires.


Expiry Date

Expiry Date is the date when your investment product is settled. Your return from this product will be automatically credited into your account on this day.


Yield

Yield is the income returned on an investment. It is expressed in percentage and is used to calculate the Settlement Amount.


Annualized Yield

Annualized Yield is calculated as the equivalent annual return you get if you continue purchasing this product with the given yield for a whole year. Its calculation formula is: Annualized Yield = Yield / (Expiry Date - Today) * 365.


Linked Price

Linked Price is a benchmark price. On Expiry Day, the Settlement Price will be compared against this benchmark price. If the Settlement Price is below the Linked Price, the product will be settled in Investment Currency (i.e. BTC in this case); otherwise, it will be settled in USDC.


Underlying Asset

An asset on which a Dual Investment product is based. For instance, if you are making a reference to BTC current price and BTC target price, then the underlying asset is BTC..

Currency

The currency you have used to subscribe to a Dual Investment product.


Settlement Price

Average of the current price in the last 30 minutes before 08:00 (UTC) on the settlement date. Settlement price and target price determines whether a product is exercised or not.

array.title: Can I redeem the investment early before the expiry date?
array.description: No early redemption is allowed. It will be settled by 8:00 UTC on the Expiry Date.

array.title: What are the potential risks?
array.description: The only uncertainty is the currency in which the product will be settled, which is determined by how the Settlement Price compares with the Linked Price. The risk of this product mainly comes from the volatility of the market: the higher the volatility, the harder it is to predict the Settlement Price and where it might be compared with the Linked Price on the Expiry Date.

array.title: When can I get my settlement, and how?
array.description: You will get your principal and return settled by 8:00 UTC on the Expiry Date. It will be credited into your wallet automatically and no manual redemption is required.

array.title: Are the products with a higher rate the better choice?
array.description: Strike price and term are the two main and correlated parameters of Dual Investment. Products with a higher return means they have a higher probability of being settled in the alternative currency. Investors need to make the investment decision based on their own preferences.
